page.title: 03EDINBANE - GESTO HOSPITAL
page.content: In 1869 Kenneth Macleod paid for the building and equipping of Gesto Hospital. He paid for a resident doctor and nurse. At one time operations were performed in this little cottage hospital, but no longer for Gesto is now a geriatic hospital. There are nineteen patients from all over Skye. Most of the elderly patients are able to be up for part of the day and spend their time in a comfortable day-room. In addition to resident staff, the doctor and a physiotherapist care for the patients on twice weekly visits. The physiotherapist plays games with them as well as helping them to exercise. School children, guides, Portree choir and other groups enjoy visiting the patients who are so cheerful and friendly. They enjoy Gaelic programmes & chatting with other Gaelic speakers.
